description: Sent to implementations for each test case.

seq.description: A sequence identifier for the test case. It must be passed along as-is in the response.
The unchanged sequence identifier originally provided in the request.

result.description: Signal that the implementation ran the test case (though may have skipped tests within it) and got the provided result.

skipped.description: Signal that the implementation skipped the test case or test (typically because it is a known bug). Either an issue URL or a human-readable message is encouraged to explain the skip.

message.description: A human-readable message passed back from the implementation explaining why the skip occurred.

issue_url.description: An optional link to a relevant issue on the implementation's bug tracker.

errored.description: Signal that the implementation encountered an internal error (which it caught). Additional context can be passed along (e.g. a traceback or exception detail).

context.description: Additional implementation-specific or language-specific context available when the error was caught.

traceback.description: A language-specific traceback (backtrace) containing stack frames or fuller debugging information on where the error occurred.

stderr.description: The raw (captured) contents of standard error from within the harness. Prefer using 'traceback' if the contents are a traceback.
